name: venafi
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing venafi cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`venafi` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/Venafi/terraform-provider-venafi).

accessToken.description: Access token for TPP, user should use this for authentication

apiKey.description: API key for Venafi Cloud. Example: 142231b7-cvb0-412e-886b-6aeght0bc93d

devMode.description:
When set to true, the resulting certificate will be issued by an ephemeral, no trust CA rather than enrolling using
Venafi Cloud or Platform. Useful for development and testing.

tppPassword.description: Password for WebSDK user. Example: password

tppUsername.description: WebSDK user for Venafi Platform. Example: admin

trustBundle.description:
Use to specify a PEM-formatted file that contains certificates to be trust anchors for all communications with the
Venafi Web Service. Example: trust_bundle = "${file("chain.pem")}"

url.description: The Venafi Web Service URL.. Example: https://tpp.venafi.example/vedsdk

zone.description:
DN of the Venafi Platform policy folder or name of the Venafi Cloud zone. Example for Platform: testpolicy\\vault
Example for Venafi Cloud: Default

provider.description:
The provider type for the venafi package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

apiKey.description: API key for Venafi Cloud. Example: 142231b7-cvb0-412e-886b-6aeght0bc93d

devMode.description:

Venafi Cloud or Platform. Useful for development and testing.

tppPassword.description: Password for WebSDK user. Example: password

tppUsername.description: WebSDK user for Venafi Platform. Example: admin

trustBundle.description:

Example for Venafi Cloud: Default

accessToken.description: Access token for TPP, user should use this for authentication

apiKey.description: API key for Venafi Cloud. Example: 142231b7-cvb0-412e-886b-6aeght0bc93d

devMode.description:
When set to true, the resulting certificate will be issued by an ephemeral, no trust CA rather than enrolling using
Venafi Cloud or Platform. Useful for development and testing.

tppPassword.description: Password for WebSDK user. Example: password

tppUsername.description: WebSDK user for Venafi Platform. Example: admin

trustBundle.description:
Use to specify a PEM-formatted file that contains certificates to be trust anchors for all communications with the
Venafi Web Service. Example: trust_bundle = "${file("chain.pem")}"

url.description: The Venafi Web Service URL.. Example: https://tpp.venafi.example/vedsdk

zone.description:
DN of the Venafi Platform policy folder or name of the Venafi Cloud zone. Example for Platform: testpolicy\\vault
Example for Venafi Cloud: Default

algorithm.description:
Key encryption algorithm, either `RSA` or `ECDSA`.
Defaults to `RSA`.

certificate.description: The X509 certificate in PEM format.

chain.description:
The trust chain of X509 certificate authority certificates in PEM format
concatenated together.

commonName.description: The common name of the certificate.

customFields.description:
Collection of Custom Field name-value pairs to
assign to the certificate.

ecdsaCurve.description: ECDSA curve to use when generating a key

expirationWindow.description:
Number of hours before certificate expiry
to request a new certificate.

issuerHint.description:
Used with valid_days to indicate the target
issuer when using Trust Protection Platform.  Relevant values are: "DigiCert",
"Entrust", and "Microsoft".

keyPassword.description: The password used to encrypt the private key.

pkcs12.description: A base64-encoded PKCS#12 keystore secured by the `key_password`.

privateKeyPem.description: The private key in PEM format.

rsaBits.description:
Number of bits to use when generating an RSA key.
Applies when `algorithm=RSA`.  Defaults to `2048`.

sanDns.description:
List of DNS names to use as alternative
subjects of the certificate.

sanEmails.description:
List of email addresses to use as
alternative subjects of the certificate.

sanIps.description:
List of IP addresses to use as alternative
subjects of the certificate.

validDays.description:
Desired number of days for which the new
certificate will be valid.

sanEmails.description:

alternative subjects of the certificate.

sanIps.description:
List of IP addresses to use as alternative
subjects of the certificate.

validDays.description:
Desired number of days for which the new
certificate will be valid.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Certificate resources.

policySpecification.description:
The JSON-formatted certificate policy
specification.  Typically read from a file using the `file` function.

zone.description:
The *Trust Protection Plaform* policy folder or
*Venafi as a Service* application and issuing template.

policySpecification.description:
The JSON-formatted certificate policy
specification.  Typically read from a file using the `file` function.

zone.description:
The *Trust Protection Plaform* policy folder or
*Venafi as a Service* application and issuing template.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Policy resources.

policySpecification.description:
The JSON-formatted certificate policy
specification.  Typically read from a file using the `file` function.

zone.description:
The *Trust Protection Plaform* policy folder or
*Venafi as a Service* application and issuing template.

certificateType.description: Indicates whether the SSH certificate is for client or server authentication.

destinationAddresses.description: A list of one or more valid IP or CIDR destination hosts where the certificate will authenticate.

extensions.description: A list of key-value pairs that contain certificate extensions from the CA template for client certificates. Allowed values (case-sensitive): *permit-X11-forwarding, permit-agent-forwarding, permit-port-forwarding, permit-pty, permit-user-rc*

folder.description: The DN of the policy folder where the SSH certificate object will be created.

forceCommand.description: A command to run after successful login.

keyId.description: The identifier of the requested SSH certificate.

keyPassphrase.description: Passphrase for encrypting the private key.

keySize.description: Number of bits to use when creating a key pair. (e.g. 3072)

objectName.description: The friendly name of the SSH certificate object. When not specified the `key_id` is used for the friendly name. If the object already exists the old certificate is archived and the CA issues a new certificate.

principals.description: A list of user names for whom the requested certificate will be valid.

privateKey.description: The private key for the SSH certificate if generated by Venafi.

publicKey.description: The OpenSSH formatted public key that will be used to generate the SSH certificate.

publicKeyFingerprint.description: The SHA256 fingerprint of the SSH certificate's public key.

publicKeyMethod.description: Specifies whether the public key will be "local" (default), "file" or "service" generated.

serial.description: The serial number of the SSH certificate.

signingCa.description: The SHA256 fingerprint of the CA that signed the SSH certificate.

sourceAddresses.description: A list of one or more valid IP or CIDR addresses that can use the SSH certificate.

validFrom.description: The date the SSH certificate was issued.

validHours.description: Desired number of hours for which the certificate will be valid.

validTo.description: The date the SSH certificate will expire.

windows.description: Specifies whether the private key will use Windows/DOS style line breaks.

extensions.description: A list of key-value pairs that contain certificate extensions from the CA template for client certificates. Allowed values (case-sensitive): *permit-X11-forwarding, permit-agent-forwarding, permit-port-forwarding, permit-pty, permit-user-rc*

folder.description: The DN of the policy folder where the SSH certificate object will be created.

forceCommand.description: A command to run after successful login.

keyId.description: The identifier of the requested SSH certificate.

keyPassphrase.description: Passphrase for encrypting the private key.

keySize.description: Number of bits to use when creating a key pair. (e.g. 3072)

objectName.description: The friendly name of the SSH certificate object. When not specified the `key_id` is used for the friendly name. If the object already exists the old certificate is archived and the CA issues a new certificate.

validHours.description: Desired number of hours for which the certificate will be valid.

windows.description: Specifies whether the private key will use Windows/DOS style line breaks.

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing venafi cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:

> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi/pulumi-venafi` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-venafi/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`Venafi/terraform-provider-venafi` repo](https://github.com/Venafi/terraform-provider-venafi/issues).
